comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: A KeyName index search reveals John Edward Ismay registered his grocery business on 21 July 1903. It was located on Illawarra Road, Marrickville. - srwww.records.nsw.gov.au/indexsearch/searchhits_nocopy.as.... But on which corner?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: I was wrong - note "Henry Power, House and Land Agent" next door. According to the Sands Directory, they operated from the same premises at 573 King Street South, Newtown (west side, intersection with Lord Street) from 1893-1895. - www.sydneyarchives.info/sands-1893 From 1896-1899 they are listed as operating from adjoining premises at 633 and 635 King Street South, Newtown (though still west side, intersection with Lord Street - looks like the numbering changed). - www.sydneyarchives.info/sands-1896 Henry Power was still operating from 635 King Street South, Newtown in 1900, but Ismay had moved. - www.sydneyarchives.info/sands-1900 Looks like the building was later demolished during the sextuplication of the railway line in 1927. - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newtown_railway_station,_Sydney#His... Google Maps Street View - maps.google.com.au/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&...

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Great detective work and a great spot of Henry Power's business behind that post, thank you! I've amended the info above and passed along your research for Photo Investigator to be updated.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] It would be total beachcombing, after all it's called the SANDS Directory ;-D
